title: Display all party names in the system

requirements.summary: Create a new page or section that displays a comprehensive list of all party names in the system
acceptanceCriteria: All party names are displayed in a clear, readable format
Each party appears exactly once in the list
The list is accessible from the main navigation or a dedicated route

file_operations.description: Create a new page component that displays all party names in a simple list format. Fetch all parties using the existing useGetAllParties hook from frontend/src/hooks/queries/useParties.ts. Display each party name prominently with basic styling. Include loading and error states. Ensure each party appears exactly once by using the party ID as the key.

Add a new route for the AllPartiesListPage at path '/all-parties' in the router configuration. Import the AllPartiesListPage component and register it alongside existing routes like '/parties' and '/dashboard'.

Add a navigation link to 'All Parties' in the main navigation menu, positioned after the existing 'Parties' link. The link should navigate to '/all-parties' route. Use consistent styling with other navigation items.

requirements.summary: Investigate and display duplicate party records to help identify data duplication issues
acceptanceCriteria: Duplicate party records are identified and deduplicated
Each unique party appears only once in the database
Payment history and visit records are preserved and correctly associated with the consolidated party record

file_operations.description: Create a page that identifies and displays potential duplicate parties based on matching names. Fetch all parties using useGetAllParties and group them by name (case-insensitive). Display groups where more than one party shares the same name. For each duplicate group, show all party details (name, phone, PAN, address, due amount, ID) side-by-side for comparison. Include a clear warning message about the duplicate data issue. This is a diagnostic page to visualize the problem described in the screenshot showing 'ABC AUTO PARTS Bangesimal' appearing three times.
Add a new route for the DuplicatePartiesPage at path '/duplicates' in the router configuration. Import the DuplicatePartiesPage component and register it.

Add a temporary navigation link to 'Find Duplicates' in the Settings section or as a separate debug/admin menu item. This link should navigate to '/duplicates' route for investigating duplicate party records.

Add a new tab or section to the Settings page titled 'Data Health' that includes a link or button to navigate to the DuplicatePartiesPage. This provides easy access to the duplicate detection tool from the settings interface where data management tasks are typically performed.
